summary: Brie Larson Confirms Marvel Wants to Make Captain Marvel a "Big Feminist Movie"
title: Brie Larson Confirms Marvel Wants to Make Captain Marvel a "Big Feminist Movie"
body:
Brie Larson Confirms Marvel Wants to Make Captain Marvel a “Big Feminist Movie”

Brie Larson confirmed Marvel approached her to make Captain Marvel a “big feminist movie.”

Speaking with Entertainment Tonight during a set visit last May, Brie Larson confirmed Marvel approached her about making Captain Marvel a feminist movie.

“I had a meeting with Marvel and what we discussed is they wanted to make a big feminist movie.”

Director Anna Boden would confirm the feminist nature of…

summary: Marvel Studios’ “Captain Marvel” to be Released in ScreenX
title: Marvel Studios’ “Captain Marvel” to be Released in ScreenX
body:
Marvel Studios’ “Captain Marvel” to be Released in ScreenX

CJ 4DPLEX, the world’s leading cinema technology company, announced today that Marvel Studios’ “Captain Marvel,” is coming to theaters in the ScreenX format on March 8, 2018. “Captain Marvel” will be the third movie from Marvel to be converted into ScreenX, and the latest collaboration between The Walt Disney Studios and CJ 4DPLEX, following the globally successful ScreenX release of “Black…

summary: Captain Marvel Producer Confirms Comic Book Origin Altered
title: Captain Marvel Producer Confirms Comic Book Origin Altered
body:
Captain Marvel Producer Confirms Comic Book Origin Altered

Captain Marvel producer Jonathan Schwartz confirmed that Carol Danvers’ origin as Ms. Marvel in the comic books was altered for the big screen.

Schwartz spoke to Entertainment Tonight during a set visit last May.

He told ET, “That origin story had to be updated a little bit for a modern audience. I’m really curious to see what fans of the character think about what we’ve done with that moment.”

C…

tags: regardless i'm still going to go see captain marvel when it comes out lol
summary: I feel like I should be excited for Captain Marvel because like, woman superhero in the MCU getting her own movie, looks cool...
body: I feel like I should be excited for Captain Marvel because like, woman superhero in the MCU getting her own movie, looks cool and stuff. But there’s just something about the trailers that’s kind of off-putting to me and for the longest time I couldn’t really figure out why, but I think I have an idea why and I think it’s her voice. Not that I think Brie Larson has a bad voice, but the way she sounds in the trailers just…doesn’t sound right? Like that her voice doesn’t match the character. Brie Larson’s normal speaking voice, from watching featurettes and stuff, seems better suited to Captain Marvel than how she sounds in the trailers. Mostly. There’s like…one or two lines to me that don’t sound off. I’m hoping that it’s just the way the trailers are made that her voice sounds like it does and not that she’ll sound like that throughout the entire movie. I’m wondering if maybe it’s part of that phenomenon where higher pitched women’s voices are more attractive to men (in general) that’s being used deliberately for the trailer, but I don’t know.

I’m wondering if maybe it’s part of that phenomenon where higher pitched women’s voices are more attractive to men (in general) that’s being used deliberately for the trailer, but I don’t know.

Not that I think Brie Larson has a bad voice, but the way she sounds in the trailers just…doesn’t sound right? Like that her voice doesn’t match the character. Brie Larson’s normal speaking voice, from watching featurettes and stuff, seems better suited to Captain Marvel than how she sounds in the trailers. Mostly. There’s like…one or two lines to me that don’t sound off. I’m hoping that it’s just the way the trailers are made that her voice sounds like it does and not that she’ll sound like that throughout the entire movie. I’m wondering if maybe it’s part of that phenomenon where higher pitched women’s voices are more attractive to men (in general) that’s being used deliberately for the trailer, but I don’t know.

But there’s just something about the trailers that’s kind of off-putting to me and for the longest time I couldn’t really figure out why, but I think I have an idea why and I think it’s her voice. Not that I think Brie Larson has a bad voice, but the way she sounds in the trailers just…doesn’t sound right? Like that her voice doesn’t match the character. Brie Larson’s normal speaking voice, from watching featurettes and stuff, seems better suited to Captain Marvel than how she sounds in the trailers. Mostly. There’s like…one or two lines to me that don’t sound off. I’m hoping that it’s just the way the trailers are made that her voice sounds like it does and not that she’ll sound like that throughout the entire movie. I’m wondering if maybe it’s part of that phenomenon where higher pitched women’s voices are more attractive to men (in general) that’s being used deliberately for the trailer, but I don’t know.

blog.name: negaifreak
blog.title: NegaiFreak
blog.description: The stories start here!

title: Sunset Shimmer = Captain Marvel?
body:
Well, in my case anyways. You might wanna take a look at my Sunset-based stories before I continue any further: https://www.fanfiction.net/u/3776529/NegaiFreak

So looking back at my stories and what I’m going through right now, I’ve noticed that I’ve made Sunset Shimmer become somewhat like a certain Marvel hero that flies around and shoots lasers from her hands. Now the key thing here is that Sunset is not like Carol in canon. 

I’ve written Sunset in a way where she’s charming, but also sympathetic. She doesn’t just let people walk over her pr her friends so easily and would fight to protect the people she cares about the most. When I look at someone like Captain Marvel, I have the exact same feelings and hope that she’ll be someone who fights for others over herself.

And seeing how Marvel Studios insists on making Captain Marvel the forefront of their films from this point on, allow me to share with you what I’m doing with Sunset’s character for the future in my fics.

  1. She’s going to go through memory lapses and power failure for quite a while. Because of the injuries she obtained in “Omni Force: WAR” and the truth she learned, she never wants to remember any of it.
  2. She’s going to want to be left alone, even demanding that time for herself. The pain she went through can’t be healed with just a simple talk or words.
  3. She’ll only trust those she knows she can. This may put her and her teammates at risk when in certain crises in the future.
  4. She’ll have to learn to accept what happened. It’s not like she’ll forgive and forget, but she needs to be honest with both herself and those around her. Otherwise, she won’t grow.

I kinda wrote this little analysis just because I made Sunset such a central figure in my fics. Also, I noticed the similarities she shares with the MCU’s Captain Marvel thus far.

Anyways, looking forward to talking about Captain Marvel in March!
